mods.note: WATER SUPPLIES The fresh water creek of Khor El Beled, The ruins of El Beled may be seen in the background. In the foreground is the canal cut'- 'to the site at which it is proposed to instal a pumping plant. The slow moving mountain stream of Eahaq. The water is quite shallow and discharges at the rate of about 2 cu.secs. over a cliff to the Larbat Wadi below.

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

physicalDescription.extent: Materials: 1 black and white photographDimensions: 85 x 138mm, on sheet 331 x 202mm

mods.abstract: Photograph of Khor El Beled [Khawr al Balid], a fresh water creek in the province Dhofar, in the Sultanate of Muscat and Oman.This photograph is part of a series of photographs that appear at the end of a preliminary report on the land resources of Dhofar, produced by Brian Joseph Hartley, Director of Agriculture, Aden, and dated 20 March 1948.
